scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: As I remember, Adam, it was upon this fashion

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: bequeathed me by will but poor a thousand crowns,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: and, as thou sayest, charged my brother, on his

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: blessing, to breed me well: and there begins my

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: sadness. My brother Jaques he keeps at school, and

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: report speaks goldenly of his profit: for my part,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: he keeps me rustically at home, or, to speak more

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: properly, stays me here at home unkept; for call you

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: that keeping for a gentleman of my birth, that

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: differs not from the stalling of an ox? His horses

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: are bred better; for, besides that they are fair

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: with their feeding, they are taught their manage,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: and to that end riders dearly hired: but I, his

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: brother, gain nothing under him but growth; for the

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: which his animals on his dunghills are as much

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: bound to him as I. Besides this nothing that he so

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: plentifully gives me, the something that nature gave

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: me his countenance seems to take from me: he lets

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: me feed with his hinds, bars me the place of a

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: brother, and, as much as in him lies, mines my

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: gentility with my education. This is it, Adam, that

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: grieves me; and the spirit of my father, which I

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: think is within me, begins to mutiny against this

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: servitude: I will no longer endure it, though yet I

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: know no wise remedy how to avoid it.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: Yonder comes my master, your brother.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Go apart, Adam, and thou shalt hear how he will

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: shake me up.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Now, sir! what make you here?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Nothing: I am not taught to make any thing.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: What mar you then, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Marry, sir, I am helping you to mar that which God

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: made, a poor unworthy brother of yours, with idleness.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Marry, sir, be better employed, and be naught awhile.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Shall I keep your hogs and eat husks with them?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: What prodigal portion have I spent, that I should

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: come to such penury?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Know you where your are, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: O, sir, very well; here in your orchard.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Know you before whom, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Ay, better than him I am before knows me. I know

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: you are my eldest brother; and, in the gentle

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: condition of blood, you should so know me. The

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: courtesy of nations allows you my better, in that

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: you are the first-born; but the same tradition

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: takes not away my blood, were there twenty brothers

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: betwixt us: I have as much of my father in me as

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: you; albeit, I confess, your coming before me is

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: nearer to his reverence.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: What, boy!

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Come, come, elder brother, you are too young in this.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Wilt thou lay hands on me, villain?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: I am no villain; I am the youngest son of Sir

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Rowland de Boys; he was my father, and he is thrice

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: a villain that says such a father begot villains.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: Wert thou not my brother, I would not take this hand

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: from thy throat till this other had pulled out thy

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: tongue for saying so: thou hast railed on thyself.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: Sweet masters, be patient: for your father's

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: remembrance, be at accord.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Let me go, I say.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: I will not, till I please: you shall hear me. My

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: father charged you in his will to give me good

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: education: you have trained me like a peasant,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: obscuring and hiding from me all gentleman-like

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: qualities. The spirit of my father grows strong in

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: me, and I will no longer endure it: therefore allow

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: me such exercises as may become a gentleman, or

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: give me the poor allottery my father left me by

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: testament; with that I will go buy my fortunes.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: And what wilt thou do? beg, when that is spent?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Well, sir, get you in: I will not long be troubled

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: with you; you shall have some part of your will: I

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: pray you, leave me.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ORLANDO
line: I will no further offend you than becomes me for my good.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Get you with him, you old dog.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: Is 'old dog' my reward? Most true, I have lost my

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: teeth in your service. God be with my old master!

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: ADAM
line: he would not have spoke such a word.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Is it even so? begin you to grow upon me? I will

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: physic your rankness, and yet give no thousand

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: crowns neither. Holla, Dennis!

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: DENNIS
line: Calls your worship?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Was not Charles, the duke's wrestler, here to speak with me?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: DENNIS
line: So please you, he is here at the door and importunes

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: DENNIS
line: access to you.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Call him in.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: 'Twill be a good way; and to-morrow the wrestling is.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Good morrow to your worship.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Good Monsieur Charles, what's the new news at the

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: new court?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: There's no news at the court, sir, but the old news:

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: that is, the old duke is banished by his younger

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: brother the new duke; and three or four loving lords

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: have put themselves into voluntary exile with him,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: whose lands and revenues enrich the new duke;

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: therefore he gives them good leave to wander.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Can you tell if Rosalind, the duke's daughter, be

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: banished with her father?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: O, no; for the duke's daughter, her cousin, so loves

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: her, being ever from their cradles bred together,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: that she would have followed her exile, or have died

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: to stay behind her. She is at the court, and no

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: less beloved of her uncle than his own daughter; and

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: never two ladies loved as they do.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Where will the old duke live?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: They say he is already in the forest of Arden, and

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: a many merry men with him; and there they live like

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: the old Robin Hood of England: they say many young

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: gentlemen flock to him every day, and fleet the time

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: carelessly, as they did in the golden world.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: What, you wrestle to-morrow before the new duke?

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Marry, do I, sir; and I came to acquaint you with a

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: matter. I am given, sir, secretly to understand

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: that your younger brother Orlando hath a disposition

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: to come in disguised against me to try a fall.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: To-morrow, sir, I wrestle for my credit; and he that

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: escapes me without some broken limb shall acquit him

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: well. Your brother is but young and tender; and,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: for your love, I would be loath to foil him, as I

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: must, for my own honour, if he come in: therefore,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: out of my love to you, I came hither to acquaint you

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: withal, that either you might stay him from his

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: intendment or brook such disgrace well as he shall

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: run into, in that it is a thing of his own search

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: and altogether against my will.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Charles, I thank thee for thy love to me, which

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: thou shalt find I will most kindly requite. I had

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: myself notice of my brother's purpose herein and

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: have by underhand means laboured to dissuade him from

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: it, but he is resolute. I'll tell thee, Charles:

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: it is the stubbornest young fellow of France, full

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: of ambition, an envious emulator of every man's

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: good parts, a secret and villanous contriver against

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: me his natural brother: therefore use thy

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: discretion; I had as lief thou didst break his neck

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: as his finger. And thou wert best look to't; for if

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: thou dost him any slight disgrace or if he do not

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: mightily grace himself on thee, he will practise

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: against thee by poison, entrap thee by some

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: treacherous device and never leave thee till he

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: hath ta'en thy life by some indirect means or other;

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: for, I assure thee, and almost with tears I speak

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: it, there is not one so young and so villanous this

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: day living. I speak but brotherly of him; but

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: should I anatomize him to thee as he is, I must

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: blush and weep and thou must look pale and wonder.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: I am heartily glad I came hither to you. If he come

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: to-morrow, I'll give him his payment: if ever he go

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: alone again, I'll never wrestle for prize more: and

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: CHARLES
line: so God keep your worship!

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Farewell, good Charles.

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: Now will I stir this gamester: I hope I shall see

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: an end of him; for my soul, yet I know not why,

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: hates nothing more than he. Yet he's gentle, never

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: schooled and yet learned, full of noble device, of

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: all sorts enchantingly beloved, and indeed so much

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: in the heart of the world, and especially of my own

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: people, who best know him, that I am altogether

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: misprised: but it shall not be so long; this

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: wrestler shall clear all: nothing remains but that

scene: SCENE I.  Orchard of Oliver's house.
speaker: OLIVER
line: I kindle the boy thither; which now I'll go about.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: I pray thee, Rosalind, sweet my coz, be merry.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Dear Celia, I show more mirth than I am mistress of;

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: and would you yet I were merrier? Unless you could

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: teach me to forget a banished father, you must not

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: learn me how to remember any extraordinary pleasure.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: Herein I see thou lovest me not with the full weight

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: that I love thee. If my uncle, thy banished father,

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: had banished thy uncle, the duke my father, so thou

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: hadst been still with me, I could have taught my

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: love to take thy father for mine: so wouldst thou,

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: if the truth of thy love to me were so righteously

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: tempered as mine is to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Well, I will forget the condition of my estate, to

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: rejoice in yours.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: You know my father hath no child but I, nor none is

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: like to have: and, truly, when he dies, thou shalt

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: be his heir, for what he hath taken away from thy

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: father perforce, I will render thee again in

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: affection; by mine honour, I will; and when I break

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: that oath, let me turn monster: therefore, my

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: sweet Rose, my dear Rose, be merry.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: From henceforth I will, coz, and devise sports. Let

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: me see; what think you of falling in love?

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: Marry, I prithee, do, to make sport withal: but

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: love no man in good earnest; nor no further in sport

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: neither than with safety of a pure blush thou mayst

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: in honour come off again.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: What shall be our sport, then?

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: Let us sit and mock the good housewife Fortune from

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: her wheel, that her gifts may henceforth be bestowed equally.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: I would we could do so, for her benefits are

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: mightily misplaced, and the bountiful blind woman

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: doth most mistake in her gifts to women.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: 'Tis true; for those that she makes fair she scarce

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: makes honest, and those that she makes honest she

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: makes very ill-favouredly.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Nay, now thou goest from Fortune's office to

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Nature's: Fortune reigns in gifts of the world,

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: not in the lineaments of Nature.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: No? when Nature hath made a fair creature, may she

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: not by Fortune fall into the fire? Though Nature

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: hath given us wit to flout at Fortune, hath not

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: Fortune sent in this fool to cut off the argument?

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Indeed, there is Fortune too hard for Nature, when

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Fortune makes Nature's natural the cutter-off of

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: Nature's wit.

scene: SCENE II.  Lawn before the Duke's palace.
speaker: CELIA
line: Peradventure this is not Fortune's work neither, but

speaker: CELIA
line: Orlando.

speaker: JAQUES
line: I thank you for your company; but, good faith, I had

speaker: JAQUES
line: as lief have been myself alone.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: And so had I; but yet, for fashion sake, I thank you

line: God be wi' you: let's meet as little as we can.

line: I do desire we may be better strangers.

speaker: JAQUES
line: I pray you, mar no more trees with writing

speaker: JAQUES
line: love-songs in their barks.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I pray you, mar no more of my verses with reading

line: them ill-favouredly.

speaker: JAQUES
line: Rosalind is your love's name?

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Yes, just.

speaker: JAQUES

speaker: ORLANDO

line: christened.

speaker: ORLANDO

speaker: JAQUES
line: You are full of pretty answers. Have you not been

line: acquainted with goldsmiths' wives, and conned them

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Not so; but I answer you right painted cloth, from

speaker: JAQUES
line: You have a nimble wit: I think 'twas made of

line: Atalanta's heels. Will you sit down with me? and

speaker: JAQUES
line: we two will rail against our mistress the world and

speaker: JAQUES
line: all our misery.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I will chide no breather in the world but myself,

speaker: ORLANDO
line: against whom I know most faults.

speaker: JAQUES
line: The worst fault you have is to be in love.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: 'Tis a fault I will not change for your best virtue.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I am weary of you.

speaker: ORLANDO

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Aside to CELIA  I will speak to him, like a saucy

speaker: ROSALIND
line: lackey and under that habit play the knave with him.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Do you hear, forester?

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Very well: what would you?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: I pray you, what is't o'clock?

speaker: ORLANDO
line: You should ask me what time o' day: there's no clock

speaker: ORLANDO
line: in the forest.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Then there is no true lover in the forest; else

speaker: ROSALIND
line: sighing every minute and groaning every hour would

speaker: ROSALIND
line: detect the lazy foot of Time as well as a clock.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: And why not the swift foot of Time? had not that

speaker: ORLANDO
line: been as proper?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: By no means, sir: Time travels in divers paces with

speaker: ROSALIND
line: divers persons. I'll tell you who Time ambles

speaker: ROSALIND
line: withal, who Time trots withal, who Time gallops

speaker: ROSALIND
line: withal and who he stands still withal.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I prithee, who doth he trot withal?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Marry, he trots hard with a young maid between the

speaker: ROSALIND
line: contract of her marriage and the day it is

speaker: ROSALIND
line: solemnized: if the interim be but a se'nnight,

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Time's pace is so hard that it seems the length of

speaker: ROSALIND
line: seven year.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Who ambles Time withal?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: With a priest that lacks Latin and a rich man that

speaker: ROSALIND
line: hath not the gout, for the one sleeps easily because

speaker: ROSALIND
line: he cannot study, and the other lives merrily because

speaker: ROSALIND
line: he feels no pain, the one lacking the burden of lean

speaker: ROSALIND
line: and wasteful learning, the other knowing no burden

speaker: ROSALIND
line: of heavy tedious penury; these Time ambles withal.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Who doth he gallop withal?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: With a thief to the gallows, for though he go as

speaker: ROSALIND
line: softly as foot can fall, he thinks himself too soon there.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Who stays it still withal?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: With lawyers in the vacation, for they sleep between

speaker: ROSALIND
line: term and term and then they perceive not how Time moves.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Where dwell you, pretty youth?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: With this shepherdess, my sister; here in the

speaker: ROSALIND
line: skirts of the forest, like fringe upon a petticoat.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Are you native of this place?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: As the cony that you see dwell where she is kindled.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Your accent is something finer than you could

speaker: ORLANDO
line: purchase in so removed a dwelling.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: I have been told so of many: but indeed an old

speaker: ROSALIND
line: religious uncle of mine taught me to speak, who was

speaker: ROSALIND
line: in his youth an inland man; one that knew courtship

speaker: ROSALIND
line: too well, for there he fell in love. I have heard

speaker: ROSALIND
line: him read many lectures against it, and I thank God

speaker: ROSALIND
line: I am not a woman, to be touched with so many

speaker: ROSALIND
line: giddy offences as he hath generally taxed their

speaker: ROSALIND
line: whole sex withal.

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I prithee, recount some of them.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: No, I will not cast away my physic but on those that

speaker: ROSALIND
line: are sick. There is a man haunts the forest, that

speaker: ROSALIND
line: abuses our young plants with carving 'Rosalind' on

speaker: ROSALIND
line: their barks; hangs odes upon hawthorns and elegies

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Rosalind: if I could meet that fancy-monger I would

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: ROSALIND
line: quotidian of love upon him.

line: I am he that is so love-shaked: I pray you tell me

speaker: ORLANDO
line: your remedy.

line: There is none of my uncle's marks upon you: he

speaker: ROSALIND
line: taught me how to know a man in love; in which cage

speaker: ROSALIND
line: of rushes I am sure you are not prisoner.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: What were his marks?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: A lean cheek, which you have not, a blue eye and

speaker: ROSALIND
line: sunken, which you have not, an unquestionable

speaker: ROSALIND
line: spirit, which you have not, a beard neglected,

speaker: ROSALIND
line: which you have not; but I pardon you for that, for

speaker: ROSALIND
line: simply your having in beard is a younger brother's

speaker: ROSALIND
line: revenue: then your hose should be ungartered, your

speaker: ROSALIND
line: bonnet unbanded, your sleeve unbuttoned, your shoe

speaker: ROSALIND
line: untied and every thing about you demonstrating a

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: ROSALIND
line: are rather point-device in your accoutrements as

speaker: ROSALIND
line: loving yourself than seeming the lover of any other.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Fair youth, I would I could make thee believe I love.

line: Me believe it! you may as soon make her that you

speaker: ROSALIND
line: love believe it; which, I warrant, she is apter to

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: ROSALIND
line: points in the which women still give the lie to

speaker: ROSALIND
line: their consciences. But, in good sooth, are you he

speaker: ROSALIND
line: that hangs the verses on the trees, wherein Rosalind

line: is so admired?

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Rosalind, I am that he, that unfortunate he.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: But are you so much in love as your rhymes speak?

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Neither rhyme nor reason can express how much.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Love is merely a madness, and, I tell you, deserves

speaker: ROSALIND
line: as well a dark house and a whip as madmen do: and

speaker: ROSALIND
line: the reason why they are not so punished and cured

speaker: ROSALIND
line: is, that the lunacy is so ordinary that the whippers

speaker: ROSALIND
line: are in love too. Yet I profess curing it by counsel.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Did you ever cure any so?

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Yes, one, and in this manner. He was to imagine me

speaker: ROSALIND
line: his love, his mistress; and I set him every day to

speaker: ROSALIND
line: woo me: at which time would I, being but a moonish

speaker: ROSALIND
line: youth, grieve, be effeminate, changeable, longing

speaker: ROSALIND
line: and liking, proud, fantastical, apish, shallow,

speaker: ROSALIND
line: inconstant, full of tears, full of smiles, for every

speaker: ROSALIND
line: passion something and for no passion truly any

speaker: ROSALIND
line: thing, as boys and women are for the most part

speaker: ROSALIND
line: cattle of this colour; would now like him, now loathe

speaker: ROSALIND
line: him; then entertain him, then forswear him; now weep

speaker: ROSALIND
line: for him, then spit at him; that I drave my suitor

speaker: ROSALIND
line: from his mad humour of love to a living humour of

speaker: ROSALIND
line: madness; which was, to forswear the full stream of

speaker: ROSALIND
line: the world, and to live in a nook merely monastic.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: And thus I cured him; and this way will I take upon

speaker: ROSALIND
line: me to wash your liver as clean as a sound sheep's

speaker: ROSALIND
line: heart, that there shall not be one spot of love in't.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: I would not be cured, youth.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: I would cure you, if you would but call me Rosalind

speaker: ROSALIND
line: and come every day to my cote and woo me.

speaker: ORLANDO
line: Now, by the faith of my love, I will: tell me

speaker: ORLANDO
line: where it is.

speaker: ROSALIND
line: Go with me to it and I'll show it you and by the way

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: ORLANDO
line: With all my heart, good youth.

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: man's good wit seconded with the forward child

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: AUDREY
line: I am not a slut, though I thank the gods I am foul.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: JAQUES

speaker: AUDREY
line: Well, the gods give us joy!

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: Amen. A man may, if he were of a fearful heart,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: but the wood, no assembly but horn-beasts. But what

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: though? Courage! As horns are odious, they are

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: necessary. It is said, 'many a man knows no end of

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: knows no end of them. Well, that is the dowry of

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: his wife; 'tis none of his own getting. Horns?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: Even so. Poor men alone? No, no; the noblest deer

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: hath them as huge as the rascal. Is the single man

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: bachelor; and by how much defence is better than no

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: skill, by so much is a horn more precious than to

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: want. Here comes Sir Oliver.

speaker: CELIA
line: horse-stealer, but for his verity in love, I do

line: think him as concave as a covered goblet or a

speaker: CELIA

speaker: ROSALIND

speaker: CELIA

speaker: ROSALIND
line: You have heard him swear downright he was.

speaker: CELIA
line: 'Was' is not 'is:' besides, the oath of a lover is

speaker: CELIA
line: no stronger than the word of a tapster; they are

speaker: CELIA
line: both the confirmer of false reckonings. He attends

speaker: CELIA

speaker: ROSALIND

line: Thou tell'st me there is murder in mine eye:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: 'Tis pretty, sure, and very probable,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: That eyes, that are the frail'st and softest things,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Who shut their coward gates on atomies,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: And if mine eyes can wound, now let them kill thee:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Now counterfeit to swoon; why now fall down;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Or if thou canst not, O, for shame, for shame,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Lie not, to say mine eyes are murderers!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Now show the wound mine eye hath made in thee:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PHEBE
line: Scratch thee but with a pin, and there remains

speaker: PHEBE
line: Some scar of it; lean but upon a rush,

speaker: PHEBE

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: If ever,--as that ever may be near,--

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIUS
line: That love's keen arrows make.

speaker: PHEBE
line: But till that time

speaker: PHEBE
line: Come not thou near me: and when that time comes,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: And why, I pray you? Who might be your mother,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: That you insult, exult, and all at once,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: Over the wretched? What though you have no beauty,--

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: As, by my faith, I see no more in you

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.

line: Why, what means this? Why do you look on me?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: ROSALIND
line: I see no more in you than in the ordinary

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: ROSALIND

line: 'Tis not your inky brows, your black silk hair,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: WILLIAM

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: 'So so' is good, very good, very excellent good; and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
line: yet it is not; it is but so so. Art thou wise?

speaker: WILLIAM
line: Ay, sir, I have a pretty wit.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: WILLIAM

speaker: TOUCHSTONE

speaker: HYMEN
line: Or have a woman to your lord:

speaker: HYMEN
line: You and you are sure together,

speaker: HYMEN
line: As the winter to foul weather.

speaker: HYMEN
line: Whiles a wedlock-hymn we sing,

speaker: HYMEN
line: Feed yourselves with questioning;

speaker: HYMEN
line: That reason wonder may diminish,

speaker: HYMEN
line: How thus we met, and these things finish.

speaker: HYMEN
line: Wedding is great Juno's crown:

speaker: HYMEN
line: O blessed bond of board and bed!

speaker: HYMEN
line: 'Tis Hymen peoples every town;

speaker: HYMEN
line: High wedlock then be honoured:

speaker: HYMEN
line: Honour, high honour and renown,

speaker: HYMEN
line: To Hymen, god of every town!

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: O my dear niece, welcome thou art to me!

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Even daughter, welcome, in no less degree.

speaker: PHEBE
line: I will not eat my word, now thou art mine;

speaker: PHEBE
line: Thy faith my fancy to thee doth combine.

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Let me have audience for a word or two:

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: I am the second son of old Sir Rowland,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: That bring these tidings to this fair assembly.

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Duke Frederick, hearing how that every day

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Men of great worth resorted to this forest,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Address'd a mighty power; which were on foot,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: In his own conduct, purposely to take

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: His brother here and put him to the sword:

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: And to the skirts of this wild wood he came;

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Where meeting with an old religious man,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: After some question with him, was converted

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: Both from his enterprise and from the world,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: His crown bequeathing to his banish'd brother,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: And all their lands restored to them again

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: That were with him exiled. This to be true,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: I do engage my life.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Welcome, young man;

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Thou offer'st fairly to thy brothers' wedding:

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: To one his lands withheld, and to the other

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: A land itself at large, a potent dukedom.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: First, in this forest, let us do those ends

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: That here were well begun and well begot:

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: And after, every of this happy number

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: That have endured shrewd days and nights with us

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Shall share the good of our returned fortune,

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: According to the measure of their states.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Meantime, forget this new-fall'n dignity

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: And fall into our rustic revelry.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Play, music! And you, brides and bridegrooms all,

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: With measure heap'd in joy, to the measures fall.

speaker: JAQUES
line: Sir, by your patience. If I heard you rightly,

speaker: JAQUES
line: The duke hath put on a religious life

speaker: JAQUES
line: And thrown into neglect the pompous court?

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
line: He hath.

speaker: JAQUES
line: To him will I : out of these convertites

speaker: JAQUES
line: There is much matter to be heard and learn'd.

speaker: JAQUES
line: You to your former honour I bequeath;

speaker: JAQUES
line: Your patience and your virtue well deserves it:

speaker: JAQUES
line: You to a love that your true faith doth merit:

speaker: JAQUES
line: You to your land and love and great allies:

speaker: JAQUES
line: You to a long and well-deserved bed:

speaker: JAQUES
line: And you to wrangling; for thy loving voyage

speaker: JAQUES
line: Is but for two months victuall'd. So, to your pleasures:

speaker: JAQUES
line: I am for other than for dancing measures.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Stay, Jaques, stay.

speaker: JAQUES
line: To see no pastime I what you would have

speaker: JAQUES
line: I'll stay to know at your abandon'd cave.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: Proceed, proceed: we will begin these rites,

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
line: As we do trust they'll end, in true delights.
